metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21151 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Processor optimization removal or modification of security-critical code for some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access. Alysa Milburn, Jason Brandt, Avishai Redelman and Nir Lavi discovered that some Intel processors improperly optimised security-critical code. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-21151` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20220510.0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Alysa Milburn, Jason Brandt, Avishai Redelman and Nir Lavi

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20220510.0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
